honestly he cried more while we were trying to get him to bed and constantly waking up with him he now sleeps straight through the night til morning with only the occasional wake up it might be hard having got used to interrupted nights after two years of it since it means her baby days are really drawing to close had the same issue as you and as you was against cio we did end up trying it because was totally exhausted as my son was getting up at unpredictable frequency and times of the night the cio did not work for us he could and did cry for hours to be exact with no signs of giving up the only thing that finally taught my son to sleep through the night was the sleep sense program using the chair method what you have to do is when he wakes up put him back down if he is able to stand as mine did and say key phrases goodnight sleep tight he will be very upset as mine was and this went on for hours the first night hours the second night and the 3rd night he slept through and he has gotten up since then to nurse we are going on our second month of sleeping through the night it was tough nights had to endure but told myself that unlike the cio he sees that am here in the room and am trying to help him sleep you will have moments during the process where you will think this is going to work but persevere as it worked for me and had tried everything even my loathed cio the sleep sense program is found online and to purchase it is 29 which is sooooooo worth it spent way more money with sleep consultants and did get the results got here there are some babies that will always need nursing until they are years old but that feeding does happen at am it happens around am my daughter has finally started to sleep through some nights now at 23 months
